title: Apache Solr: Your site was unable to contact the Apache Solr server
description:
Hi,

Upon installation of Apache Solr 4.4 to Drupal version 6.3.1 , we have encountered an error 

"
Apache Solr: Your site was unable to contact the Apache Solr server
"


We have sought assistance from our technician, but to no resolve, the error still persist. We were advised to seek council to the developer of the software. We are hoping that you could further help us with this.

For more information you can visit this link to solr
http://50.28.38.245:8983/solr/admin

A message from the technician that tried to help us too.


Hello,

I have copied the solrconfig.xml, schema.xml, and protowords.txt from
/home/infocuse/public_html/citybay/sites/all/modules/apachesolr/ to
/home/solr-4.3.1/example/solr/collection1/conf, as according to the module
information page, it needs this information:

https://drupal.org/project/apachesolr

However, these configuration files appear to not be compatible with this
version of Solr. They are missing various configuration sections within the
solrconfig that is new in Solr 4.3.1 that the apachesolr does not provide.

Best regards,

Ariel

comments.author: Erick Erickson
comments.content:
First, please raise issues like this on the user's list first, then raise a JIRA.

Second, this is most like a Drupal issue, I suggest you ping the Drupal user's list first.
